Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice or Type B kantharos; discoloured white slip; interior glazed streaky dark brown; traces of two faded bands in added colour; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: A paper label is glued to the interior surface with the number 1 written in pencil. The numbers 76, 734 and 1 are written in pencil on the exterior surface of the sherd. The size of the sherd, the lack of diagnostic elements and the absence of decoration on the interior and exterior surfaces make it impossible to determine whether it came from a kantharos or a chalice. Chalice Style chalices (including patterned chalices) have little decoration on their interior and exterior. Given the size of the sherd, it may come from an undecorated part of the chalice. Kantharoi Type B (See Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983, 169) have very little decoration as well.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 679, no. 385)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1406) (phase 2)
